column4: oh well, once I get it all working, I'm sure it'll all be worth it :)
well, I have it up and running ok, I guess it's not 'barely functional'.
mainly I'm trying to get xgl working, and the first step is getting nvidia drivers up and running
well, regardless, I haven't gotten to the xgl part yet. At this point, I can't even get the nvidia drivers to install
oh so many errors :) I dont' even know where to start
heh, that's very true
ok, so if I do an apt-get install nvidia-glx nvidia-kernel-common, it will install both packages seamlessly
I'm setting up ubuntu 6.06 with kernel 2.6.15-19-amd64-generic
so anyways, nvidia-glx and nvidia-kernel-common install fine, but when I edit the xorg-conf file to include nvidia instead of nv, the xserver just won't start
I tried both of those
we can really only help with breezy sorry
why?
on all installs it works fine so far
stick with breezy for now until dapper is released
if i can offer one piece of advice when you are leaerning anything technical ....
sure
I've spent like 60 hours researching... I only come here as a last resort
no worries, consider me part of your research then
or they need it for work like me :(
theonly way is to write a little bash script with some regex to do that ... i can't really help you write it, but thats how its done
but be warned, make sure you have a backup of everything
